t:
As a child, I liked to spend my time at my grandparents'. There, sitting in their library, reading books and going on adventures, I'd forget that I was bullied at school for being girlish.
That library had seen many breakdowns, and many secrets — hidden behind the bookshelf was a diary with things only I wished to know. Or so I'd thought.

Now years after my grandfather's death, I'm back here in the library, turning the pages of that diary. Worm eaten and yellowed after ages, was a page with one of my secrets, “I like boys.”

And now, just under it, was another line in my grandfather's handwriting,
  “I loved a boy once too. Don't hide your identity.”
c:
Being rejected is hard, but being unrealistic is harder.
